title: Kids Against Plastic | UNESCO
body: It quickly became clear that plastic pollution was a common thread, and so began their on-the-ground activism. In 2016, Kids Against Plastic was born. Paving the way for less plastic Now with 50 young members, KAP aims to increase awareness around single-use plastic, as well as empowering young people to take action for what they believe in.
readable_content:
- UNESCO (2023-12-08): Two sisters, Amy and Ella Meek, have established Kids Against Plastic to combat plastic pollution by engaging young people. The organization works to raise awareness about single-use plastic and promote the use of reusable alternatives. With over 50 young members, KAP collaborates with various entities to minimize the use of the Big 4 plastic items. Amy and Ella also focus on youth empowerment and have inspired numerous schools and businesses to join their Plastic Clever scheme. Additionally, the project is seeking sponsorship, social media support, press relations, communication strategy design, and partnerships development.

- UNESCO (2023-12-08): The project's website is [kidsagainstplastic.co.uk](https://www.kidsagainstplastic.co.uk).
